intro: Epiluma, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow or white flower heads. Epiluma species typically have a compact growth habit and are often used in rock gardens or as ornamental plants. They are drought-tolerant and prefer well-drained soils.
